data.title: Shop Local: Mishti Chocolate
data.meta_description: If you watch my instagram stories, you know I LOVE heading to the local farmers market every Saturday morning. I love walking around and meeting all the small shop owners + farmers with each a…
data.text:
If you watch my instagram stories, you know I LOVE heading to the local farmers market every Saturday morning. I love walking around and meeting all the small shop owners + farmers with each and every purchase.

I find it super important to shop local. WHY?

Improve local economy

Supporting another entrepreneurs hard work

Supporting your community (money also stays within your community)

Better customer service + personalized service

Shopping local helps environment; less food miles reduces fossil fuels + emissions

So typically when I head to the market I stock up on veggies for the week, some Griggstown eggs + turkey burgers and I satisfy those pregnancy cravings with Mishti Chocolate, an organic + local small shop. They have the most delicious lavender chocolate bars – you must try them!

Check out my interview below with the owner of Mishti Chocolate, Puneet Girdhar.

So what does MISHTI stand for?

Puneet: Mishti is our elder daughter’s name. It means sweet in one of the Indian languages.

So sweet! Why did you decide to create Mishti chocolate?

Puneet: Mishti was created after our Mishti was born. Mishti our elder daughter was born with a lot of allergies and dairy was one of the biggest of all. I wanted to share my passion and taste for chocolate with her and create something that is not just good to taste but also has fine quality ingredients.

I love that! Every child deserves to eat chocolate haha. What do you currently sell?

Puneet: So far we sell 14 different types of chocolate bars (ranging from vegan milk to 100% dark chocolate) and hot chocolate mix.

Flavors include moon light, coffee, toffee, dark night, dark moon, cocktail, lavender, mango, pineapple, ginger + more!
